meanings.sent1: The wind dissipated the leaves across the yard.
meanings.sent2: She watched as the smoke dissipated into the air.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to make the cards dissipated into thin air.
meanings.sent4: His anger dissipated like mist in the morning sun.
meanings.sent5: The crowd dissipated after the concert ended.

meanings.definition: To indulge in excessive pleasure or luxury
meanings.sent1: He dissipated his wealth on extravagant vacations.
meanings.sent2: She would often dissipated her time in fancy restaurants.
meanings.sent3: The cat dissipated in the sun all day long.
meanings.sent4: Her worries dissipated as she relaxed in the spa.
meanings.sent5: The children dissipated in laughter at the amusement park.

meanings.sent1: The dissipated money left him in financial trouble.
meanings.sent2: She regretted her dissipated opportunities in the past.
meanings.sent3: The dissipated food in the fridge had to be thrown away.
meanings.sent4: His dissipated efforts resulted in failure.
meanings.sent5: The dissipated time could have been used more productively.

meanings.definition: Dispersed or scattered in various directions
meanings.sent1: The dissipated clouds allowed the sun to shine through.
meanings.sent2: The dissipated crowd slowly left the stadium.
meanings.sent3: The dissipated confetti covered the ground after the celebration.
meanings.sent4: Her dissipated thoughts made it hard to focus.
meanings.sent5: The dissipated scent of flowers filled the garden.
